column4: ooo, never seen screem before... it should get more publicity  :(
simple... can edit what it knows about what you want installed via /var/lib/debfoster/keeps
k, thx... i've used deborphan, this seems to be able to do more
yeah... deborphan just tells you about libraries that aren't in use... debfoster informs you about packages not dependent on anything else, and allows you to do something about it...
my current install is a fresh hoary... with latest breezy stuff...
i'm not touching my source file for atleast 3-4 weeks :)
it is actually far afterwards that you encounter issues... next gnome isn't in etc... new oo.o is, but I haven't played enough to see if that has issues...
removes xpdf and gnome-gs though, and installs evince, so I'm a happy camper  :)
i've been running oo.o2 and evince for months now ;)
I don't like to play with ubuntu-desktop much (because then its harder to figure out if I fucked something up with bug reports) ... having 2 copies of OO.o installed annoyed me
well, i installed ubuntu-desktop back just before upgrading to hoary final, so right now i do have oo & oo2, still i can live with it for a while
the packages that are being used will be built with gcc4
not if you already did a sudo -i  8)
